sentences.sContent: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.sCn: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

remMethod.val: pre(预先) + jud(判断) + ice → 预先判断 → 偏见， 成见

words.tran: 怀偏见的；有成见的；偏颇的
不利的；有害的；引起偏见的
损害（prejudice的过去分词）；使抱偏见

trans.tranOther: to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something
an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
